comments:
I just got an java.lang.OutOfMemoryError. E has been up for a couple of days 
and it is up to 120MB RAM according to the W2K Task Manager. This happened 
during a CVS Sync I think (but I am not sure). This is not a very helpful 
report I know but please let me know what other config info I can turn in.

I start E with a shortcut:

C:\eclipse-R2.0.1\eclipse.exe --vm c:\java\j2sdk1.4.0_01\bin\javaw.exe -
data "C:\Documents and Settings\ggregory.PC1073\My 
Documents\eclipse\workspaces" vmargs -Xmx256m

You seem to be missing the "-" at the beginning of the "vmargs" argument.  Also,
you have an extra "-" at the beginning of the vm argument.  I don't know if this
is the problem, but you should have:

C:\eclipse-R2.0.1\eclipse.exe -vm c:\java\j2sdk1.4.0_01\bin\javaw.exe -data
"C:\Documents and Settings\ggregory.PC1073\My Documents\eclipse\workspaces"
-vmargs -Xmx256m


Please re-open if you continue to experience this behaviour after following 
John's suggestions.
I have fixed my short cut and will update this space if the problem persists, 
which I doubt.
Thank you.
